title: British tourist's naked body found on beach in India as police launch murder investigation
text:

Police have launched a murder investigation after the body of a British tourist was found naked on an Indian beach. 
The woman, who police have named as Danielle McLaughlin, 28, was believed to have been visiting Goa with a friend to celebrate the Indian festival of Holi. 
Her naked body was discovered on Deobag Beach by a local early on Tuesday morning. 
She had suffered extensive injuries to her face. 
It is thought that she lived in Liverpool, but may have been born in Ireland. 
The local police have registered a case of murder and have arrested one person, but are waiting for Danielle's post-mortem report to ascertain if she was sexually assaulted before being killed. 
Police Inspector Filomeno Costa told reporters: "A local named Prashant Komarpant alerted us after he noticed the body while he was on his way to the fields around 7am on Tuesday morning. 
"The body had bruises and her face was badly smashed. Looking at the injuries we concluded that that it was a case of murder. We sent her body to Goa Medical College for autopsy and awaiting report to ascertain if she was sexually assaulted 
"We are also speaking with the hotels where she had stayed to find out if she was with her friends or holidaying alone." 
Police are also studying the CCTV footage of all the shacks the victim visited on Monday night, and are working with teams of sniffer dogs and forensic teams. 
While the police found the deceased's clothes, they are yet to locate the murder weapon.
